--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Chris Christenson <cc57@t...> wrote:
> 
> Ken,
> 
> You mentioned that people have tried training along with NEAT.  Do
you
> know who actually tried it and how I might be able to contact them?
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> -Chris C

Hi Chris,

By training I assume you mean backprop?  Actually, I don't think I
said people have tried training NEAT with backprop before.  (That I
know of- people can correct me if I'm wrong)  What I meant to say was
that people have tried combining *neuroevolution* (non-NEAT methods)
with backprop before.  Some examples are Xin Yao, and Bin Zhang
(separately).  Also Nolfi and Parisi have several papers about using
backprop during evolution to simulate a learning process anologous to
what happens in nature where organisms learn during their lifetime. 
You can find mostof this stuff through citeseer :
http://citeseer.nj.nec.com/
That is a research index of articles.  Let me know if you have trouble
finding the relevant research.

If by training you just mean learning over a lifetime, rather than
backprop specifically, my own paper on adaptive NEAT talks about this,
but it's probably not what you are referring to:

http://steam.csres.utexas.edu/nn/pub-view.php?RECO
RD_KEY(Pubs)=PubID&PubID(Pubs)=131

If you are having trouble adding backprop to the network classes 
in NEAT, let me know also since I may be able to help you.

ken
